title: Temp issue
description: temp

title: Test issue
description: temp

title: SearchBench v1 transformation (revised spec)
description: Transform browse-comp-v2 into searchbench per revised spec: strict provider modes, curated queries, bias-mitigated judge, adaptive timeouts, HTML reporting, and history tracking.
close_reason: All tracked SearchBench transformation beads completed.

title: Foundation scaffold + config + provider base
description: Create the new package skeleton, config loader, and provider base/registry as specified.
acceptance_criteria:
- pyproject.toml defines searchbench package + CLI entrypoint
- config.toml defaults + dotenv loader available
- provider base + registry exist under searchbench/providers
close_reason: Scaffolded package, config, and provider base already implemented.

title: Judge: GPT-4o-mini + bias mitigation
description: Implement bias-mitigated GPT-4o-mini judge with preflight and fallback grading.
acceptance_criteria:
- Binary grading with equivalence handling
- Preflight runs 5 cases and fails if <4/5
- Fallback heuristic for LLM failures
- Plausible/implausible rubric when expected is null
close_reason: Implemented GPT-4o-mini judge with bias-mitigated prompt, preflight, and robust fallback grading.

title: Reporter + history
description: Generate HTML report and append-only history.json with latency percentiles and timeouts.
acceptance_criteria:
- Writes results/latest.html + dated report HTML
- Summary table sorted by accuracy; methodology included
- Appends results/history.json with p50/p95/p99 and timeout events
- Includes per-query details section
close_reason: Implemented HTML reporter and history tracking with summary tables, trends, methodology, and timeout event logging.

title: CLI: Typer commands
description: Implement CLI commands per spec and wire to runner/judge/reporter.
acceptance_criteria:
- Commands: run, quick, history, providers, report, validate, add, calibrate
- quick runs 10 random queries
- validate checks API keys + judge preflight
- report outputs latest report path (open if supported)
close_reason: Implemented Typer CLI with run, quick, history, validate, providers, report, add, and calibrate commands wired to core modules.

title: Adaptive timeout calibration
description: Implement calibrate logic using history p99 + 20% buffer with config overrides.
acceptance_criteria:
- Suggests timeouts with p99*1.2, clamp 15-60s
- Requires >=10 samples, else defaults
- Can apply changes to config.toml when --apply is set
close_reason: Implemented adaptive timeout calibration from history with p99+20% logic and config.toml update helper.

title: Tests: providers + judge
description: Add provider unit tests and judge validation tests.
acceptance_criteria:
- tests/test_providers.py covers error/timeout parsing
- tests/test_judge.py validates preflight and grading formats
close_reason: Added provider and judge unit tests covering timeout/error handling and verdict parsing.

title: Docs + .env.example updates
description: Update README and .env.example for searchbench with verified 2025 pricing and usage.
acceptance_criteria:
- README reflects searchbench name/tagline and core workflow
- .env.example lists all provider keys + judge key
- Pricing table updated to 2025 values
close_reason: Updated README and .env.example for searchbench usage, pricing, and configuration.

title: Identity + cleanup to searchbench
description: Rename internal references to searchbench and remove legacy browse-comp-v2 components (dataset loader, terminal visualizer, compact sessions, basic query set, fallbacks).
acceptance_criteria:
- README/tagline and package references say searchbench
- Legacy BrowseComp dataset/XOR logic removed
- Terminal visualizer + compact session mode removed
- No silent fallbacks or escalation logic remain
close_reason: Removed legacy BrowseComp code and utilities, updated repo guidance to SearchBench structure, and pruned obsolete files.

title: Provider: Exa /answer only
description: Implement Exa provider using /answer endpoint only with 2025 pricing and strict mode.
acceptance_criteria:
- Calls https://api.exa.ai/answer only
- No /research escalation or retries that change behavior
- Cost per query set to $0.01 and captured
- Uses config timeout and returns answer + citations
close_reason: Implemented Exa /answer provider with strict mode, 2025 pricing, timeout handling, and citation normalization.

title: Provider: Parallel v1beta strict
description: Implement Parallel search v1beta strict mode with required headers and pricing.
acceptance_criteria:
- Calls https://api.parallel.ai/v1beta/search
- Sends parallel-beta: search-extract-2025-10-10 header
- No Tavily fallback or query simplification retries
- Cost per query set to $0.005 and captured
close_reason: Implemented strict Parallel v1beta provider with required beta header, single-pass request, and cost/latency capture.

title: Provider: Tavily baseline
description: Implement Tavily /search with include_answer, basic depth, and fair costing.
acceptance_criteria:
- Uses https://api.tavily.com/search with include_answer=true
- search_depth=basic (no advanced mode)
- Tracks cost (free tier vs $0.008 paid)
- Uses config timeout
close_reason: Implemented Tavily baseline provider with basic search, include_answer, timeout/error handling, and configurable cost mode.

title: Provider: Brave Search
description: Implement Brave Web Search API with AI summary enabled and 2025 pricing.
acceptance_criteria:
- Uses Brave Web Search API endpoint
- summary=1 enabled
- Cost per query set to $0.005 and captured
- Parses summary + citations and uses config timeout
close_reason: Implemented Brave Web Search provider with summary enabled, citation extraction, and strict error handling.

title: Provider: Linkup standard
description: Implement Linkup standard search endpoint with 2025 pricing.
acceptance_criteria:
- Uses https://api.linkup.so/v1/search
- mode=standard only
- Cost per query set to ~$0.0055 and captured
- Uses config timeout and returns answer + citations
close_reason: Implemented Linkup standard provider with strict mode, 2025 pricing, and conservative response parsing.

title: Query sets + loader
description: Implement public/private query sets and loader utilities per spec.
acceptance_criteria:
- searchbench/queries/public.json contains 50 curated items across categories
- searchbench/queries/private.json template is gitignored
- Loader supports public, private, or explicit path
- Supports queries without expected answers
close_reason: Added query loader utilities, public 50-question set, and private template with gitignored private.json.

title: Runner: concurrency + timing + costing
description: Implement concurrent runner with latency tracking, errors/timeouts, and cost aggregation.
acceptance_criteria:
- Executes providers concurrently per query
- Captures latency_ms, errors, timed_out per provider
- Aggregates p50/p95/p99 latency per provider
- Tracks total cost per provider and run
close_reason: Implemented concurrent runner with timing, cost aggregation, and latency percentiles per provider.

title: SearchBench operational setup
description: Configure local environment, validate, run benchmark, then rename repo directory and remote.
close_reason: Operational setup complete: keys configured, quick benchmark run, repo renamed and remote updated.

title: Configure API keys in .env
description: Set provider API keys in .env while preserving any existing OpenAI key.
acceptance_criteria:
- .env contains keys for exa, parallel, brave, linkup, tavily
- Existing OPENAI_API_KEY preserved if present
close_reason: Added provider API keys to .env while preserving any existing OpenAI key.

title: Validate + run quick benchmark
description: Install deps, validate setup, run quick benchmark and generate report.
acceptance_criteria:
- Dependencies installed
- searchbench validate succeeds (OpenAI key required)
- searchbench quick produces latest.html
close_reason: Installed dependencies, validated keys/judge, and ran quick benchmark generating results/latest.html.

title: Rename repo directory + update git remote
description: Rename local folder to searchbench and update remote URL once testing is complete.
acceptance_criteria:
- Local folder renamed to searchbench
- git remote updated to new repo name
close_reason: Renamed repo directory to searchbench and updated origin remote URL.

title: Add richer CLI error breakdown
description: Include per-provider error breakdown in CLI output for run/quick and latest summary.
acceptance_criteria: - run/quick prints an error breakdown table\n- summary displays latest error breakdown if available\n- history stores error samples
close_reason: Added error breakdown tables in CLI and stored error samples in history.

title: Design and build next-level hard web benchmark
description: Research existing hard web/browsing benchmarks and design a new brutally hard query set and scoring flow for SearchBench, then wire it into the CLI and reporting.
acceptance_criteria:
- Hard benchmark spec documented
- New hard query set added and wired into CLI
- Judge supports evidence-based scoring for hard queries
- Initial hard benchmark run produces report
close_reason: Hard benchmark spec, query set, wiring, and initial run completed.

title: Research existing hard web benchmarks
description: Identify relevant benchmarks (e.g., BrowseComp, WebArena, WebGPT/ELI5, AgentBench) and extract useful design patterns for hard questions and scoring.
acceptance_criteria: - Short research summary captured\n- Key design patterns summarized
close_reason: Captured research summary for existing web benchmarks.

title: Define hard benchmark schema + scoring
description: Specify query format, evidence requirements, grading rubric, and any new history fields needed.
acceptance_criteria: - Schema documented (fields + examples)\n- Scoring rubric documented
close_reason: Documented evidence-gated schema and scoring changes for the hard benchmark.

title: Curate hard query set
description: Create a brutally hard public query set with verified answers and required sources.
acceptance_criteria: - Hard query JSON committed\n- Minimum 50 questions with expected answers + sources
close_reason: Added hard.json with 75 evidence-gated queries across hard categories.

title: Implement hard benchmark scoring + CLI wiring
description: Update judge/runner/reporting to support evidence-based scoring and add CLI flag or query set name for hard benchmark.
acceptance_criteria: - Judge supports evidence requirements\n- CLI can run hard queries\n- Report includes hard benchmark metadata
close_reason: Implemented evidence gating in judge/reporting and wired hard queries into CLI.

title: Run hard benchmark + validate results
description: Execute the hard benchmark, review accuracy + error breakdown, and capture initial report.
acceptance_criteria: - Hard benchmark run completed\n- Report generated + sanity checked
close_reason: Ran hard benchmark and generated updated report/history entries.

title: SearchBench v1 transformation (revised spec)
description: Transform browse-comp-v2 into searchbench per revised spec: strict provider modes, curated queries, bias-mitigated judge, adaptive timeouts, HTML reporting, and history tracking.

title: Investigate Linkup provider errors
description: Full benchmark run returned 50 errors for Linkup (0% accuracy). Diagnose API response shape, auth, or request params and fix provider implementation.
acceptance_criteria: - Linkup queries return successful results in a standalone run\n- Benchmark run shows non-zero accuracy and zero unexpected errors
close_reason: Fixed Linkup payload/response handling; provider returns answers.

title: Add CLI summary table output
description: Provide a CLI-friendly summary table after runs and via a dedicated command for the latest benchmark results.
acceptance_criteria: - CLI prints a readable summary table for run/quick\n- New command can show latest run summary from history.json\n- README/AGENTS mention the command
close_reason: Added CLI summary output, new summary command, and doc updates.

title: Mitigate provider rate limits in hard benchmark
description: Hard benchmark run hit Brave 429s under query concurrency. Add guidance or throttling to avoid rate-limit skew, and document concurrency env vars.
acceptance_criteria:
- Provide recommended QUERY_CONCURRENCY/JUDGE_CONCURRENCY settings
- Optional per-provider throttling or backoff for 429s
- Document the guidance in README
